text.0: raising his voice the king hath flowed upon his way invested with the waters he would win the kine.
text.1: the fleece retains his solid parts as though impure and bright and cleansed he seeks the special place of gods.
text.2: thou soma art effused for indra by the men balmed in the wood as wave sage viewer of mankind.
text.3: full many are the paths whereon thou mayest go a thousand bay steeds hast thou resting in the bowls.
text.4: apsarases who dwell in waters of the sea sitting within have flowed to soma wise of heart.
text.5: they urge the master of the house upon his way and to the eternal pavamana pray for bliss.
text.6: soma flows on for us as winner of the kine winner of thousands cars water and light and gold.
text.7: he whom the gods have made a gladdening draught to drink the drop most sweet to taste wealbringing red of hue.
text.8: soma as pavamana thou our faithful friend making for us these real treasures flowest on.
text.9: slay thou the enemy both near andfar away grant us security and ample pasturage.
